input:

43:54 Caption: Luka Milivojevic (Olympiacos Piraeus) takes a shot from the free kick on the edge of the box and the ball sails inches wide of the right post. What a chance!
44:07 Event: Ball out of play

45:51 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
45:59 Caption: There was plenty of entertainment during the first 45 minutes. Hopefully more of the same in the second half. Bayern Munich dominated the opening period and easily created the most chances. The visitors have been very flat and lacked creativity in their attack. Let's see if they change something in the second period.

41:06 Event: Indirect free-kick by Olympiakos
42:47 Caption: Chance! Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) was in a good position inside the box, but he couldn't connect with the pass as it was overhit.

46:33 Caption: Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) dribbles deep into the box and releases a strike towards the left side of the goal, but Roberto Jimenez makes a sensational reflex save and punches the ball onto the post. Superb goalkeeping! Bayern Munich win a corner.

47:01 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
47:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Bayern Munich were better today and displayed masterful control and movement. The home side destroyed their opponents in every aspect of the game. The visitors offered very little going forward.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Bayern Munich delivered an emphatic display as they completely outclassed Olympiakos in a Champions League encounter at the Allianz Arena, securing a 4-0 victory that saw them dominate from start to finish. From the moment the opening whistle blew, Bayern Munich set the tone for what would be a relentless performance, characterized by their clinical finishing, exceptional ball control, and superior tactics.

The first half commenced with Bayern Munich kicking off at the center circle and immediately pushing forward, showcasing their attacking intent from the get-go. However, the game saw a few early breaks as the ball kept going out of play. Olympiakos managed to clear any early threats several times, but Bayern Munich quickly reinstated their attacking presence. A momentary offside by Bayern Munich at the 3:36 mark provided Olympiakos with an indirect free-kick; yet, they failed to capitalize on any advancements as Bayern’s defense remained solid.

Bayern’s persistent pressure soon paid off. Just under eight minutes in, Bayern’s first real chance came in the form of shots on target in quick succession. The initial shot was parried away, but Bayern Munich was fast to rebound, and Müller’s attempt was successful. This early goal, just 7 minutes and 34 seconds into the game, catapulted Bayern into the lead and set the stage for their commanding performance.

Barely had the celebrations died down when Bayern were once again asserting dominance over their Greek opponents. Olympiakos tried to respond but fell short each time the ball ventured near Bayern Munich's goal. Bayern maintained possession comfortably, creating opportunities with their sharp passing and movement. An excellent block from an Olympiakos defender did little to stem the tide.

By the 15th minute, Bayern had extended their lead through Robert Lewandowski. The goal came from a powerful shot from outside the box, flying past the goalkeeper and nestling into the left side of the net. Olympiakos simply couldn’t keep pace as Bayern Munich demonstrated not only their attacking prowess but also their ruthless efficiency in front of goal.

With Bayern comfortably in the driver’s seat, their passing game came to the fore. They utilized the width of the pitch, stretching Olympiakos’ defense. This approach paid dividends once more in the 19th minute. A lofted ball aimed perfectly at Thomas Müller saw the German player effortlessly slot his header into the net, making it 3-0. The fans erupted as Bayern continued to dismantle the Olympiakos defense.

Olympiakos found themselves chasing shadows for much of the first half as Bayern Munich’s players effortlessly interchanged passes and maintained possession. Despite a few clearances and off-target attempts by Olympiakos, they struggled to form any meaningful attacks. An occasional interception or foul was all they could manage as Bayern Munich kept up with their relentless pressing.

Numerous attempts were made by Bayern to increase their tally, including a few off-target shots that barely fazed their offensive rhythm. Whether it was Kingsley Coman bombing down the wing or Douglas Costa creating opportunities from set-pieces, Bayern dismantled Olympiakos with their superior technique and strategy.

The first half ended with Bayern Munich leading 3-0. The break allowed both teams to recoup, but it was clear from their body language and the stats that Bayern Munich were the favorites to continue dominating.

As the second half commenced, Olympiakos sought to change the tempo and brought in fresh energy with substitutions. However, it was Bayern who came closest to opening the second-half scoring. Almost immediately after the restart, Joshua Kimmich tested the goalkeeper with a well-aimed shot from a set-piece which was blocked.

Not all went smoothly for Bayern, though. A rare moment of contention arose when Holger Badstuber committed a foul that earned him a direct red card. Down to ten men, Bayern faced the challenge of holding onto their lead with one player less. Olympiakos tried to press their numerical advantage with several free kicks but failed to test Manuel Neuer in goal. A particularly weak effort by Arthur Masuaku directly hit the defensive wall, squandering another opportunity for the visitors.

Despite being reduced to ten men, Bayern Munich's defensive solidity and midfield control enabled them to continue dictating the pace of the game. Even with one man less on the field, Bayern meticulously maintained possession, often stringing together sequences of passes to neutralize Olympiakos’ numerical superiority.

With the clock ticking, Bayern’s coach Pep Guardiola decided to refresh his squad, bringing on players like Mehdi Benatia and Javi Martinez, who replaced the hardworking Douglas Costa. These substitutions ensured that Bayern remained formidable despite their numerical disadvantage.

Douglas Costa provided a magnificent solo effort that culminated in an impressive save by the Olympiakos goalkeeper, epitomizing Bayern's relentless pursuit of more goals.

In what was effectively the game's killing blow, Bayern registered their fourth goal in the 24th minute of the second half. Kingsley Coman latched onto a pass and his header found the back of the net, showcasing his remarkable scoring ability and Bayern's continuous bombardment of the Olympiakos goal.

As the final moments of the game unfolded, both teams saw another series of plays resulting in throw-ins, offsides, and tactical fouls. Philipp Lahm’s persistent runs and Joshua Kimmich’s contributions stood out, illustrating Bayern's elaborate tactical setup even in the face of adversity. They closed off the game with disciplined defending and controlled ball distribution.

The final whistle blew after 1 minute of added time, marking the end of a clinical masterclass by Bayern Munich and solidifying their 4-0 victory over Olympiakos. Bayern had displayed their superior skills and unequivocal dominance over every aspect of the game. Their players showed an impressive combination of technical prowess, strategic execution, and relentless drive—qualities that ensured their commanding win.

Throughout the encounter, Bayern outshone Olympiakos in every facet, from possession statistics to shot count. Olympiakos struggled to break down Bayern’s structured set-up and surrendered to the German giants' seamless transitions from defense to attack. The match served as a testament to Bayern’s ability to control and dominate matches against formidable opposition. They showcased clinical finishing, cohesive team play, and tactical flexibility, making them a formidable force in the Champions League.

In conclusion, Bayern Munich's 4-0 thrashing of Olympiakos was a game where the Bavarian giants underlined their supremacy from start to finish. Despite the setback of a red card, Bayern Munich exhibited resilience and tactical intelligence, ensuring Olympiakos had little to celebrate. From the early goals that set the tone to the final corner kicks, Bayern Munich's superiority was evident, making this game a memorable display of football excellence.
